dcterms:creator: Richard S. Sutton
Andrew G. Barto
dcterms:description: The Mountain Car problem features a car with limited engine power, meaning that it is unable to drive directly to the top of a steep valley using full throttle. The solution is for the car to oscillate left and right to build the inertia necessary to reach the goal at the top right.
dcterms:title: Mountain Car

dcterms:creator: Richard S. Sutton
Andrew G. Barto
dcterms:description: Acrobot is a freely moving double arm pendulum. The task is to apply torque to the joint between the arms and swing the end of the pendulum above a height of the length of one of the arms.
dcterms:title: Acrobot

dcterms:creator: Gary William Flake
dcterms:description: The Spiral Maze Gridworld is a grid-based environment where the agent must navigate through a spiral-shaped maze to reach the center, which serves as the goal state. The agent has to deal with walls and a stochastic environment.
dcterms:title: Spiral Maze Gridworld
